DoingBusinessAsName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Aurora Borealis Lions Eyeglass Recycling & Vision Center

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The primary focus of this foundation is to fund and operate the Aurora Borealis Lions Eyeglass Recycling & Vision Center of North Pole, Alaska; and to advance community based assistance for persons (in need) requiring eye care (eyeglasses, eye-exams, low-vision assistive devices, or more complex and expensive eye care/surgeries; all while fostering community awareness, bond and willingness to demonstrate their resilience in helping each other.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The primary focus of this foundation is to fund and operate the Aurora Borealis Lions Eyeglass Recycling & Vision Center of North Pole, Alaska; and to advance community based assistance for persons (in need) requiring eye care (eyeglasses, eye-exams, low-vision assistive devices, or more complex and expensive eye care/surgeries
IRS990.Desc: Advance community based assistance for persons (in need) requiring eye care (eyeglasses, eye-exams, low-vision assistive devices, or more complex eye care/surgeries. Accomplishments: Conducted multiple vision screening clinics, identifying suspect vision and educating nearly 1500 persons in vision impairment/treatment

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Fund and operate the Aurora Borealis Lions Eyeglass Recycling & Vision Center of North Pole, Alaska Accomplishments: Recycled 22K pairs of used eyeglasses, sending nearly 15,000 pairs to organizations supporting 3rd world country health missions and nearly 175 to Alaska residents in need.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Funds reported are based on employing a State of Alaska gaming permit, which enables generating funds for our stated charitable purpose

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Quasi endowment is intended to raise funds and use them beyond the principal to fund eye medical care services

IRS990ScheduleG.GamingManagerServicesProvTxt: Provide internal and external oversight gaming interests and activities

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Gaming permit is issued for declared charitable purposes. Distribution of net proceeds must stay within those bounds before December 31 of each year
Gaming funds generated by the North Pole Lions Foundation are donated principally to the Aurora Borealis Lions Eyeglass Recycling & Vision Center

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Provide eye care for persons deemed in need
GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Provide eye care in the form of eye exams and eyeglasses to persons deemed in need. Persons are scheduled to receive services from a local eye doctor and or vendor. No recipient received any grant more than $250

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No recipient receiving grant assistance for eye care received more $500 in assistance

Grants are primary used to offer eyecare (exams & glasses) to those determined to be "in-need". Each recipient is screened to validate their need status. No individual received grant assistance which exceeded $500

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Howard Rixie (President) is married to Dorothy Rixie (Treasurer)

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All members of Multiple District 49 Lions Clubs are automatically members of our foundation, along other non-Lion individual members

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The entire board of directors are subject to the will of the whole membership through an annual election

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Any change to the constitution and bylaws are subject to the will of the whole membership

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The entire board of directors are given an opportunity to review the draft 990 before being submitted to the IRS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The 990, Financials and governing documents are either posted to our web page or available upon request

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: Principal officials charged with completing the 990 were out of country when 990 was due; and the 990 was completed in less 30 days upon their return.
